headline: Korean BBQ-Inspired Short Ribs
description: Korean BBQ ribs are incredibly easy to make and are a tasty filling in lettuce wraps with sticky white rice, perfect for parties and barbeques.
name: Korean BBQ-Inspired Short Ribs
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup sriracha hot sauce, or to taste
3 cloves garlic, minced, or more to taste
2 pounds beef short ribs, cut 1/3-inch-thick across the bones

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk vinegar, soy sauce, sriracha hot sauce, and olive oil together in a large bowl; add brown sugar and stir until dissolved. Mix green onions, garlic, black pepper, sesame seeds, ginger, and five-spice powder into vinegar mixture until marinade is evenly combined.
Place short ribs in a large reseable bag and pour marinade over ribs; coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours.
Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.

Remove ribs from marinade and place on the grill; cook for 6 to 7 minutes. Flip ribs and spoon marinade over second side; cook until meat is no longer pink, 6 to 7 minutes more. Turn grill heat to high and cook ribs for 1 minute more per side. Remove ribs from heat and place on a plate; let rest for 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Cook time is way off on a Treager, I understand everything varies with different methods of cooking but everyone else was done eating while I was still waiting for ribs to be done. Will never do again.

Very Good! I loved the flavors of sweet and spicy. . I already went to the store and bought more short ribs so I can make it again. I added a Serrano chili to it. Other than that I made as stated. I might try this in my instapot next time.
